org.iotivity.service.server

Class RcsResourceObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.iotivity.service.RcsObject
      • org.iotivity.service.server.RcsResourceObject

  • public final class RcsResourceObject
extends RcsObject
    RCSResourceObject represents a resource. It handles any requests from clients automatically with attributes.

    It also provides an auto notification mechanism that notifies to the observers. Requests are handled automatically by defaultAction of RcsGetResponse and RcsSetResponse. You can override them and send your own response with RcsResourceObject.GetRequestHandler and RcsResourceObject.SetRequestHandler.

    For simple resources, they are simply required to notify whenever attributes are changed by a set request. In this case, add an RcsResourceObject.OnAttributeUpdatedListener with a key interested in instead of overriding RcsResourceObject.SetRequestHandler.

    See Also:
    RcsResourceObject.Builder

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RcsResourceObject.AttributesLock
      This provides the way to get the attributes of RcsResourceObject with lock.
      static class  RcsResourceObject.AutoNotifyPolicy
      Represents the policy of AutoNotify function of RCSResourceObject class In accord with this, observers are notified of attributes that are changed or updated.
      static class  RcsResourceObject.Builder
      This is a builder to create resource with properties and attributes.
      static interface  RcsResourceObject.GetRequestHandler
      Interface definition for a handler to be invoked when a get request is received.
      static interface  RcsResourceObject.OnAttributeUpdatedListener
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an attribute is updated.
      static interface  RcsResourceObject.SetRequestHandler
      Interface definition for a handler to be invoked when a set request is received.
      static class  RcsResourceObject.SetRequestHandlerPolicy
      Represents the policy of set-request handler.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
